title: High temperatures may force pool to close
text:
High temperatures may force pool to close ERIN TASKER Last updated 13:29, February 21 2017 FAIRFAX NZ 
Ashburton's EA Networks Centre pool is likely to close due to high temperatures forecast. 
Anyone wanting to escape Tuesday's heat in Ashburton and go for a swim in the pool at the EA Networks Centre may be out of luck. 
The Ashburton District Council is advising residents that the EA Networks Centre (EANC) pool may temporarily close later in the day due to unsafe high temperatures predicted which would put staff and patrons at risk. 
For health and safety reasons, the EA Networks Centre pool must close when temperatures reach 31 degrees Celsius inside the pool area, and with hot conditions predicted for Ashburton, closure was likely. 
READ MORE: * Weather change bringing highlight to Wellington summer with lingering warmth 
At 12.45pm, MetService had Ashburton's temperature at 30.3 degrees. 
"Particularly warm days like this pose a risk to the wellbeing of staff and visitors to the pool," council service delivery group manager Neil McCann said. 
"It is unsafe for people to be in these conditions, and as a precaution, we may close the EA Network Centre pool later this afternoon." 
The possible pool closure will not affect the remainder of the EANC and all other areas will operate as usual. 
"If we do have to close the EANC pool today, council will open the Tinwald Community Pool at the Tinwald Domain earlier so that residents will still be able to go for a swim in this heat," McCann said. 
People who usually attend Learn to Swim classes are being contacted through email and phone to notify them of the expected closure. Ad Feedback 
"We do understand the inconvenience this expected closure may cause to residents and hope it doesn't disrupt their routine too much." 
Council will continue to monitor conditions and will notify when a decision on the possible closure has been made. - Stuff
